bibl.title: Letter from Mabel H. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, January 13, 1902

div1.p: Mabel Lazear provides news of the children. She has received supportive letters and is still campaigning for her pension.

div1.head: Letter from Mabel H. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, January 13, 1902
div1.p:
A very
nice letter has just come
from you bringing a very
welcome check - Thank
you very much-

I shall high me to the
Bank with it this morning
Sorry to hear Francis has
a bad cold, sorry our
“Say my love Baltimore
Gannie”-

We are going to see the
Murrays this evening and
I shall ask Mr Lazear about
the box - I am so sorry you
have not received it-
Has Alex taken your
Bill of Lading to the freight
office-

As every day bring letters
to write in regard to the Pen-
sion I must close and be
at then - There last one
out have seems to have a
bad cold. The Babies have
been in the house almost
a week with colds but
to-day they seem much
better - Mrs Murray telephoned
last night - says they had
both been very miserable
with colds-

You would laugh if you
could see how pleased
Houston is when a blue
nighty comes - I just told
Houston I was writing to
you and else says,
AC
L
have all been thanking
different people for
the very kind things
they have done.

Mr Pillsbury has been
most kind and Editha
has interested so many
people to get people in
Congress interested-

Please give my best love
to Aunt Kate - With many
thanks for the check
and much love
